title: Expatriate Failure: Why Assignments Go Wrong
description: A micro-lesson that makes Expatriate Failure: Why Assignments Go Wrong usable.

hook.text: 40% of international assignments fail â€” costing companies $250,000-$1 million per failure. The #1 reason isn't skills.

buildup.text: Companies select expatriates for technical competence, then wonder why they fail.

discovery.text: The biggest predictor of expatriate success isn't IQ or experience.

twist.text: Family adjustment matters more than the employee's. If the spouse or children can't adapt, the assignment fails.

climax.text: Companies that invest in cultural training before assignments see failure rates drop from 40% to under 10%.
